public void parse(Connection connection)
           throws IOException,

MessageException
ParseException

parseMessage

protected void parseMessage(Connection connection,
                            InputStream inputStream)
                     throws IOException,
                            ParseException,
                            MessageException
Reads and parses a single message from the specified connection and connection input stream. The input stream argument may be the same one exposed by the connection, or may be an input stream that wraps the connection input stream. This method delegates parsing of message start line to derived classes via doParseStartLine(java.lang.String) and delegates message handling to derived classes via abstract method #doHandleMessage().

Throws:
MessageException - - The downstream message handler rejected the message.
ParseException - - The parser could not parse the incoming byte stream into a message. The caller should abort message processing and close the connection.
IOException - - A read operation failed because the connection was closed or unexpected IO error occurred.

doParse

protected void doParse(Connection connection)
                throws IOException,
                       ParseException,
                       MessageException
Reads and parses a single message unit from the connection. Overridden in derived classes to allow for type-specific parser method selection.

                                       throws ParseException
